title: Training Robust Deep Learning Models with Synthetic Cryo-ET Data
content: Deep learning has emerged as a powerful approach for denoising and segmenting cryo-ET data, but training data is sparse or even impossible to generate experimentally in some cases. To overcome these obstacles, we developed cryo-TomoSim (CTS), a software package that builds coarse grained models of macromolecular mixtures embedded in vitreous ice, and then simulates electron tilt series for tomogram calculation. Using simulated data, we first probe the impact of different tunable microscope parameters on the robustness of deep learning models. We then use CTS outputs to train U-Net models for both regression denoising and semantic segmentation and demonstrate their effectiveness on a variety of real tomographic inputs.
